intro: Daucus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian carrot, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and carrots. The plant features bright yellow flowers and has a taproot that is often used as a vegetable. Its leaves are fern-like and can be harvested for culinary purposes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the high-altitude regions of its native habitat.
